column4: I'm having trouble installing ubuntu... I need an installer with a kernel that includes the ahci module. For some reason, it's not included either in hoary or breezy, but the driver seems to be included in the standard kernels in apt. This is just too weird :/
it's part of the hoary kernel
well, no.
well, it is
how come I can't find it then? I've tried using both the CD and netinstall
perhaps it's not part of the installation kernel
exactly
you looked from a vt during the install?
yep
it's still not there, heh
any suggestions on how to solve this?
no tips then I gather? well, thanks anyway :-)
no, sorry; you could copy it from an installed machgine, tho
hmm... during install or do you mean copy ahci.ko and insmod it?
modprobe it during install, yeah
yeah, but I mean, where would I get it from? is there a way to copy stuff from another machine in a vt during install?
the installer has wget
oh, nice
I'll try that, thanks
well, a crippled busybox wget, but it'l be enough
I'm getting "invalid module format" when trying to insmod the module, any tips?
can I download the ahci.ko module from the standard ubuntu kernel from somewhere?
